runs.comm: nearly starts with a wicket - pitching on a great length, nipping away from the right hander and almost kissing the edge
movement away again, wider this time, Maddy cuts tamely at it - with no footwork
straighter, drops his hands down on it and they run through a single
straight as you like, forcing the defensive
on middle, short enough to be worked into midwicket for a single
speared in full, on leg, nibbled out to short cover for a quick strike-stealing single
swing in the air, up and over, but safe, landing just inside the cow-corner boundary
scrambled single to leg this time
cut off the back foot just in front of point
movement away, Solanki comes over, takes a sniff and watches the ball fly harmlessly through
short and straight, pulled in front of square for a quick single which Singh collects
short and a rising delivery, cut in front of point for another single
straight, and there was no room to hide and only one thing to do: defend
driven out to a straight mid-on for a quick single
outside off, width, and he cuts forcefully through point, puncturing some of the pressure... but only until the next ball
slower delivery, low full toss, driven to mid-on, thrown back in - but they were through
more width, Solanki waits and cuts down to third man
on off, pushed down to third man off the back foot and he steals the strike
stays over for the right hander, pushes it across him, a touch of room, and it's helped on its way courtesy of an outside edge off a back-foot cut
a well-run single into midwicket
short and Solanki was into position quickly, pulling the ball over midwicket
driven out to a straight long-off for a comfortable single
short and almost checked off the hips really, with a push in front of square
splayed behind square this time
swivels in his medium pace and beats him, the ball jumping over his bat
a touch of width and cut behind point
tighter line, and a good delivery now - play and a miss through to the keeper
driven out to mid-on and the strike's rotated again

calamity. RP Singh trips at third man on his way to trying to catch a huge top edge. He can only make a fumbling, desperate grope at the ball as it rejects his advances to fly on its merry way through. RP checks his studs afterwards
over wide long-on
angling across him from a wide angle, and he slashes and burns a chance for runs, completely missing
short outside off, Maddy rocks back on to one leg and heaves that, sweetly enough, through midwicket
up and over long-on this time
goes now - holing out to mid-on, who runs in from long-on to a straightforward chance
staying over, wideish, and pushed forward
drags it a touch short, but room enough for Solanki to cut away off the back foot for a well-hit four in front of point
on off, wrists it behind leg for a quick single
on off again, pulled away in front of square
on leg, flapped round through the 45
on leg, swept very fine to a straight long leg
uses his feet and meets the ball at what becomes half-volley length, driving it out straight to long-on
full toss, Pietersen's turn to come down the track and drive to mid-on
innocent delivery, outside off, Solanki tries the cut, is nowhere near it and a dot results
low full toss and RP Singh's studs don't give out this time as he does well to meet the straight swipe at long-on
dropped. Easy chance to Yuvraj at gully off the back foot
driven out to cover for a quick single
an easy single eased out to mid-off
firmly struck in front of midwicket, Pietersen standing tall and delivering
short, outside off, and pulled high and in front of midwicket
driven out to cover for an easy single
huge and close shout as Pietersen shuffles over - big call that, Singh striking on the line and the ball would have perhaps hit leg
driven out to cover now
full delivery, Pietersen waits and digs out a single in front of midwicket
doesn't quite come out as Singh was hoping, a leg-side full toss which is missed out on, with a tame flap to deep backward square leg
takes some of the pace off it first up, but Solanki is vigilant, driving back out to deep extra cover
steps back to give himself room to drive strongly through cover
a huge drive, mid-off scurries round but too late to meet it on the full; the ball plugs and is eventually tidied up
half-volley outside off and well driven out to long-off, but equally well picked up by Pathan who crashes on to his knees in his efforts
driven out uglily (as uglily as that made-up word) in front of midwicket
hit up towards the covers
Solanki makes room and steers into the gap in the covers
Pietersen dances at the crease but eventually settles for a measured push into the covers

at last, India hold a catch! Solanki made room again, and swished up and over the off side. This time he couldn't get enough bat on it, and mid-off circled for an eternity before clinging onto a comfortable chance
good length on off stump. Defended with caution into the covers
Collingwood is a self-professed lover of the nurdle off the pads. And it does the trick to get him off the mark
thumped down the ground but without much timing
slower ball, and Pietersen doesn't quite pick it. The ball was in the air for an age, but just plopped out of reach of deep cover. A bit of good fortune for England
driven firmly but no great power, down to long-on
stand and deliver. Collingwood steps inside the line and swats that firmly behind square. Top shot. A fraction too short, and the man drops back at deep midwicket
dabbed into the leg-side, and Collingwood threatens to take two. Pietersen isn't so keen
deposited into the stands! Far too short from Joginder, and KP climbed into it, over midwicket
now he's too full, and the umpire is in danger as Pietersen drives hard and straight. Another boundary
pitches outside leg, and Collingwood helps it on its way to midwicket
thumped into the leg-side again. England are refusing to panic just yet
short but straight. Collingwood cuts but can't beat the man at point
full, yorker length, and Collingwood misses. Dhoni does well to stop the byes
lovely bowling again. Another yorker, outside off stump this time, and a very sharp take from Dhoni who whips off the bails, but Collingwood's foot is anchored
flapped into the covers, too straight to work with, and that's another cracking over
short again. Collingwood was back on his stumps in a pre-meditated move, and couldn't quite time his attempted pull
still not getting the timing. This one bounces out to midwicket
short and slogged out to midwicket. That's not Collingwood's best game. Maybe he should try to dink a few boundaries off his hips
Pietersen's busy at the crease as well. He too is almost trying to hit it too hard, and in the end they scamper a single off an under-edged swipe
another energetic smear from Collingwood, but it's not coming off for him. One more single to short midwicket
another single. Great bowling from India. They've found their line and length and aren't letting up

that's curtains for England! A rank full-toss and Pietersen clobbered it, but straight back at the bowler. It was self-preservation first and foremost, but a great take in front of his face, and Pietersen is gone!
Shah's off the mark, but singles ain't enough ...
full length, and driven back to the bowler
fizzed down the leg-side, Dhoni takes well and pulls off the stumping attempt, but no-one's fooled
excellent shot from Shah, that's what England need. A pre-meditated sweep from outside off stump, and that races away to fine leg
another attempted sweep, but faster and flatter this time. Fine leg fields
backs away and pushed into the covers. England's asking rate rises again
sixes are what England need, and Collingwood delivers! That was clean as a whistle, into the midwicket stand
sweetly timed. Stepped across to clip an off stump full-toss backward of square leg. England are brawling. Sort of
across his stumps again, and thumped into the covers
Collingwood makes room, but the wide is still called
extraordinary shot. His first sweep worked, this one ended up as a bit of a muddle. Too much moving around the crease that time
he stands still this time, and that's gone straight through deep midwicket. Top shot
Shah's dancing again, and drives down the ground. Sreesanth is miffed and feigns a shy at the stumps as he fields in his followthrough
twirled onto a good length and driven hard into the covers. A quick call as the shy came in, but the throw is a fraction too high to pull off the run-out
full toss and a loud appeal as Shah misses with a cross-batted nurdle, but he's hit outside the line
clumped over extra-cover and picked up in the deep
short and pulled ... all the way for a maximum! There's a good catch in the crowd to boot, and England give themselves another lifeline
short-arm jab and that's another six! Joginder has the same glazed look as Stuart Broad, and England have a smidgeon of hope
over midwicket again, but not timed on this occasion
swing and a miss. That's a valuable dot ball
full and very nearly perfect. Yorker length and swings back in, just misses off stump as Shah backs away
short, wide, Dhoni can't gather and the batsmen scamper two. That's a handy bonus

short and Shah swings towards his favourite midwicket boundary, but it's high on the bat and plops straight into the hands of the fielder! England lose another well-set batsman, and their predicament just gets worse
moved outside off, went for a massive hoick over square leg, missed
moved outside off, went for a massive hoick over square leg, missed again. This time the bowler didn't. And that's comprehensively bowled
has a mow down the ground, nearly hits Flintoff at the non-striker's end
down the track to meet a thigh-high leg-side full toss - and misses out
wide down leg and the ball scurries away for four. That'll help
full toss, almost follows Wright as he makes room. Cut to backward point
Flintoff's getting and administering a bit of banter out there. Harbhajan sends down a low full toss, but it's not put away
full and straight again, and a near-miss at the non-striker's end. A direct hit would have been out
makes room again and smeared into the covers, the shy comes in but misses
another wild swing, but to no great avail
massive intent, but not enough connection. Midwicket cleans up
back of a length, and clubbed down to long-off. It's all a bit futile now
way down the leg-side but Dhoni does well to save four byes
down on one knee and slapped over the covers. Good, but not good enough
that must be the lowest-key maximum of the day. Helped over deep midwicket, to a bare ripple of appreciation

that's an incredible catch from Harbhajan on the long-on boundary! He reached up and back and plucked the six from thin air, inches inside the rope and right in front of the England dug-out! Risked life and limb and came up trumps!
Flintoff finishes with an emphatic thump that Harbhajan this time can't cut off. England reach 200 and save some pride, but it's India who march on
